command: iptables -I INPUT -m recent --name t1205_http --rcheck --seconds 60 -p tcp --dport 4444 -j ACCEPT; iptables -I INPUT -p tcp --dport 80 -m string --string "X-T1205: OPEN" --algo bm -m recent --name t1205_http --set -j LOG --log-prefix "T1205-HTTP-SIGNAL "; nc -l -p 4444 -k >/dev/null 2>&1 &
explanation: Sets a signaling rule that watches for a crafted HTTP header (X-T1205: OPEN) on port 80, logs it, and whitelists the source via iptables recent. If seen, inbound TCP/4444 is allowed for 60s where nc listens. For lab use to simulate HTTP-based traffic signaling and detection.
rationale_steps: Monitor application-layer HTTP header to set a temporary allow-list on match
Log abnormal HTTP packet content for detection and auditing
Expose a gated listener only when the signal is observed
